channel.title: Comments on: Slicing up dinosaur embryos. For science.

item.title: By: Herman Diaz
item.dc:creator: Herman Diaz
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/517-2/#comment-393">protohedgehog</a>.
I figured it belonged to some kind of theropod. Ah well, at least we have 1 probable dromaeosaur nest ( http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1475-4983.2008.00815.x/full ).
item.content:encoded:
In reply to protohedgehog.

I figured it belonged to some kind of theropod. Ah well, at least we have 1 probable dromaeosaur nest ( http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1475-4983.2008.00815.x/full ).

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/517-2/#comment-391">Herman Diaz</a>.
I believe so - location 1 is the dentary, and location 2 is the maxilla which you can see in the other photos. If you want to read the original article, it's open access so you can read it for free! :)
I think they're some sort of dromaeosaur, but can't be sure. I don't think an article has been published on it as I think the specimen is in private hands, unfortunately.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Herman Diaz.

I believe so – location 1 is the dentary, and location 2 is the maxilla which you can see in the other photos. If you want to read the original article, it’s open access so you can read it for free! ðŸ™‚

I think they’re some sort of dromaeosaur, but can’t be sure. I don’t think an article has been published on it as I think the specimen is in private hands, unfortunately.

item.title: By: Herman Diaz
item.dc:creator: Herman Diaz
item.description:
I have 2 questions: -Where in reconstruction of the embryonic skull of Hypacrosaurus is the secondary cartilage & dentine (Are they the light & dark green spots)? -What kind of dino does the nest in the 3rd pic down belong to & is there a paper describing it?
Many thanks in advance.
item.content:encoded:
I have 2 questions:
-Where in reconstruction of the embryonic skull of Hypacrosaurus is the secondary cartilage & dentine (Are they the light & dark green spots)?
-What kind of dino does the nest in the 3rd pic down belong to & is there a paper describing it?

Many thanks in advance.
